caller_intent: Carrie Simpkins is concerned about an unexpected increase in her auto insurance payment, which she attributes to her daughter-in-law being added as a driver to her policy. She wants to resolve the issue and clarify why the daughter-in-law was added, as well as backdate the addition to July.
resolution_steps: Holly asks for Carrie's address and the daughter-in-law's name to verify the policy details.
Holly checks the system but finds that backdating the daughter-in-law's addition to July is not possible through the current interface.
Holly commits to contacting National General (the carrier) directly to request backdating of the policy change.
knowledge_required: Understanding how to handle policy changes and backdating requests
Ability to verify household member details for insurance purposes
summary: Carrie Simpkins contacted Alliance Insurance Services to address an unexpected increase in her auto insurance payment, which she linked to her daughter-in-law being added as a driver. The agent verified details and will contact the carrier to backdate the policy change. The call concluded with a commitment to follow up with the carrier and inform Carrie of the resolution.
